meanings.definition: A final point in space or time.
meanings.sent1: The hike led us to the terminus of the trail, where we enjoyed a beautiful view.
meanings.sent2: The clock striking midnight marked the terminus of the old year and the beginning of the new one.
meanings.sent3: At the terminus of the maze, we found a surprise party waiting for us.
meanings.sent4: The terminus of the road seemed to stretch into eternity, like a never-ending journey.
meanings.sent5: The terminus of the river was a majestic waterfall, cascading into a pool below.

meanings.sent1: We arrived at the terminus just in time to catch the last bus home.
meanings.sent2: The train departed from the busy terminus, filled with commuters heading to work.
meanings.sent3: The terminus was bustling with travelers rushing to catch their rides.
meanings.sent4: She waited at the terminus, scanning the crowd for her friend's familiar face.
meanings.sent5: The terminus was a hub of activity, with buses coming and going at regular intervals.

meanings.definition: The end of a railway or other transportation route.
meanings.sent1: The train slowed down as it approached the terminus, coming to a gentle stop.
meanings.sent2: The terminus of the subway line was a well-lit platform with signs pointing to exits.
meanings.sent3: As the bus reached its terminus, the driver announced the end of the line.
meanings.sent4: The terminus of the highway was marked by a large sign indicating the city limits.
meanings.sent5: The terminus of the tram line was a historic station with intricate architectural details.
